ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: My child tries hard in school.
Notes: 1 = Strongly agree; 2 = Agree; 3 = Disagree; 4 = Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: My child wants to do well in school.
Notes: 1 = Strongly agree; 2 = Agree; 3 = Disagree; 4 = Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: In terms of your child's performance in math, what type of student is he/she?
Notes: 1 = Far below average; 2 = Below average; 3 = Average; 4 = Above average; 5 = Superior

ElementDescription: In terms of your child's performance in reading/English, what type of student is he/she?
Notes: 1 = Far below average; 2 = Below average; 3 = Average; 4 = Above average; 5 = Superior

ElementDescription: What are your child's average grades in school? (select one response)
Notes: 1 = Mostly As; 2 = Mostly Bs; 3 = Mostly Cs; 4 = Mostly Ds; 5 = Mostly Fs

ElementDescription: What is the average number of hours per week your child spends doing homework?
On average, how many days a month does your child miss school?
Has your child ever been suspended?
If suspended, number of times:
Has your child ever been expelled?
If expelled, number of times:
Has your child ever repeated a grade?
If expelled, number of times: grade ____
If expelled, number of times: grade ____
If expelled, number of times: grade ____
What best describes your child's high school curriculum?
Is your child in any accelerated/honors courses?
Does your child have an IEP (Individualized Education Program)?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes; 3 = No, but I have a 504 or get assistance from school resource staff

ElementDescription: If child repeated a grade, first repeated grade level
If child repeated a grade, second repeated grade level
If child repeated a grade, third repeated grade level
